posts.post_content:
T206 Hal Chase, Portrait Blue, 1909, Piedmont 350 back.  Well centered, nice color, very light wrinkle near top, no creases, some dark staining, mostly on the borders/back., no tears, no paper loss.  

***SOLD****
I missed this - what did this one go for?  I have a decent Factory 42 version on this card.

With all due respect, I don't feel right posting prices of sold cards.  For all I know, my buyer might be planning on flipping the card(s) I sell, and might not appreciate my posting their recent acquisition price.  

I'm in the camp of folks, who delete the posted price, once a card is sold.  I do leave up photos and other information about the sale, until the buyer has received the card(s) and is satisfied that I fairly represented it in my ad.

Sorry you missed my initial post.  It was a very quick sale.

[quote name="HD28Player" post=2034226]With all due respect, I don't feel right posting prices of sold cards.  For all I know, my buyer might be planning on flipping the card(s) I sell, and might not appreciate my posting their recent acquisition price.  

I'm in the camp of folks, who delete the posted price, once a card is sold.  I do leave up photos and other information about the sale, until the buyer has received the card(s) and is satisfied that I fairly represented it in my ad.

Sorry you missed my initial post.  It was a very quick sale.[/QUOTE]

Hey brother - all good on my end.  I am really trying to figure out the protocol here.  And also really trying not to offend.
